comments.body: A purpleish red or crimson colour would be really nice
The dyes only come in the classic 16-colour palette, so it's unlikely to be more.
A great idea!
I disagree. These plants are expressly for decorational purposes only. There's no need to make it "useful". The only reason it can be crafted into a dye is consistency with other flowers.

yeah one idea I had for the SNIFFER is three or more days (minecraft time) the little bush on their back grows and you can shear them off to get a *leaf clump* that can be crafted into a camouflage armor that allows you to hide from mobs or even just make the distance of the mobs sight lower when the armor is equipped but the downside it's worst than leather armor so it's a one hit break but it helps for sneaking around in the forest and like you can smelt the leaf clump to make a dessert version I've had this idea since the mob vote mobs was revealed and I just wanted to pitch it to mojang since it's very obvious this is the "adventurers update" I hope mojang sees this.
Yes, like maybe a usable shield, or an incredibly powerful one-time use weapon.

This isn't in the game because the developers want all disasters to be caused or be able to be prevented by the player. If a creeper blew up when trying to kill an iron golem it would grief your world with you having no control over, it. If a creeper blows up a player, it's the players fault if they don't kill the creeper.
No
Illogical. Iron golems only slay mobs that target villagers or attack the golems directly.
You're crazy.
No what the...
Im sorry but as a minecraft official i need to say you should not continue to promote this post
honestly yeah there is no reason why this doesn't exist and i will use it to build a big villager

First you need to change the craft of the pulpit, replacing the old bookshelves with chiseled ones.

This requires dynamic lighting.
There isn't dynamic lighting in vanilla MC, so the lamp wouldn't work.
Either the object in the frame can be seen from both sides or we can place 2 items in one on each side of the item frame. Also glow item frame variant of this.
This would be more efficient, plus a way to see which books are in them. Perhaps the GUI slots could only accept book types, and not any item like just another chest.

Look it's cool but I think there should be a usage on it you know what I mean. Like you should not like continue to just abuse something like that over, and over again. I'm not hating on your very brilliant idea, but I just think that there should just be a usage on the said item because, and I quote "It's not MineCraft if there's a non-usage bar".

The desert temple is not suitable, the creators of this grave would not want it to be plundered.
To do this, you need a separate structure - a treasure store.

Regarding the implementation - the drawings on the pots should be perceived by the observer. There must also be protection against opening the mechanism - something like an ancient guardian in a sea monument, or fountains of lava and water, which can form obsidian when opened.

This would be perfect for the Badlands/Mesa biomes! Imagine complex trapped ruins that can only be traversed if you follow the pots or use them to unlock complicated Redstone mechanism doors! That would add such interest to a biome that we usually just loot for terracotta
I kinda love this? We would need variations within the puzzle types too though.
u can do the same with redstone repeatern, just time the tick rate like u need
actually a good idea well done
